editorialNotes.standard: With its friendly approach and awesome updates, Duolingo’s long been one of our favorite apps for learning another language. Its secret: making the process genuinely fun. Engaging mini-games test your reading, writing, and speaking skills, and joining a club (where you can encourage and compete with others) adds a great social element. Bonus: all those languages and games are available for free!
editorialNotes.short: Learn a new language. Join a club, chat with bots, and get reminders to practice.
Study smarter.

editorialNotes.standard: The long-awaited moment for Toca Boca fans has arrived. Toca Boca World, the newest edition to the popular series, brings together all the Toca Life apps, letting your beloved characters from different apps mingle in one beautiful world. And this unique world keeps growing: The app continually updates with new areas to explore and characters to meet.
editorialNotes.short: Enrich your child’s imagination through creative world-building.

editorialNotes.standard: Every now and again an app comes along to blow your hair back and make you believe you’re living in a science-fiction future. Photomath lets you point your camera at the problem and a step-by-step explanation (and answer!) instantly appears on your screen. Triple-digit multiplication? Photomath’s got it. Linear and quadratic inequalities? No problem.
editorialNotes.short: Solve your maths problems and get step-by-step explanations.
Identify flowers, plants and trees with your camera.

editorialNotes.standard: Memory, reading comprehension, concise writing—they’re valuable skills everyone can improve with this powerful brain-training app. Elevate’s short, enjoyable mini-games include activities like recalling key elements from conversations and answering true-false questions as quickly as possible. As you play a few of these games each day, the app tracks your progress and creates a personalized workout that adapts as you strengthen key abilities, helping you stay motivated over time.
editorialNotes.short: Improve your learning with a personalised programme.

editorialNotes.standard: Lingokids sets kids up for success in school and beyond with thousands of activities that cleverly disguise education as entertainment.
editorialNotes.short: Enhance your child’s language development.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.short: Language lessons that you can adapt for your age and proficiency.

ios.subtitle: Learn at school, home or work

editorialNotes.standard: A winning blend of education app and game show, Kahoot! is perhaps the purest form of modern-day schooling. Students use their iPhone, iPad, or Mac to answer quiz questions in hopes of becoming the class brainiac—or create their own games to play (or study) at home.
editorialNotes.short: Create and participate in quizzes in Kahoot's fun and interactive way.

editorialNotes.standard: ClassDojo offers teachers a wonderful way to manage their classroom using an iPad or iPhone. With the app’s extremely simple interface, tracking attendance and recording students’ behavior is a snap, and ClassDojo produces helpful reports instructors can share with parents and colleagues.
editorialNotes.short: Manage your classroom and easily share reports with parents and colleagues.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: We love Imprint’s approach to learning. Beautifully animated visuals accompany click-through summaries from best-selling books and professional courses. Take quizzes along the way and save insights for reference. With a large library and many topics to choose from, there is something for everyone.

editorialNotes.short: Ask questions, search for answers and prepare for exams.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: You’ve always promised yourself you’ll learn how to play piano one day. How about today? No need to hook up a special keyboard: Simply Piano listens to what you’re playing on any keyboard or piano—or lets you use an onscreen one. Within minutes you’ll start reading music, and soon you’ll be playing along with familiar songs and adopting good habits. Even if you’ve never touched a keyboard in your life, Simply Piano makes it easy to learn.
editorialNotes.short: Learn to play piano with songs you love.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: No time to read? In just 15 minutes or less, Headway condenses best-selling nonfiction books into bite-size summaries. Enjoy a personalized feed, join challenges, and save key flash cards for your future self. We especially love the audio-only feature for learning on the go.

name: HelloTalk - Language Learning
artistName: HELLOTALK FOREIGN LANGUAGE EXCHANGE LEARNING TALK CHAT APP

editorialNotes.short: Practice your target language with native speakers.
editorialNotes.tagline: Learn a language with real people

editorialNotes.standard: Khan Academy is an education app for everyone—whether you’re a parent helping your first grader with geometry or a postgrad looking for a deep dive into microfinance. If there’s a topic you want to learn about—no matter how basic or advanced—chances are Khan Academy has a video lesson for it.
editorialNotes.short: Sharpen your skills with interactive questions and videos.

editorialNotes.tagline: Cook up a storm in the kitchen
editorialNotes.standard: Food’s fun for everyone with Toca Boca’s second go-round in the kitchen. Choose different characters and try to please their palates by preparing fish, fruit, vegetables, and more. Deciding what to serve and whether to bake, boil, fry, chop, puree, or season it—or all of the above—will keep young chefs happily cooking away.

Simply Guitar is all about you: your skills, your pace, and your comfort levels. No experience is needed—the app actually starts by asking if you even own a guitar—and after a few quick questions about your skill level and background, you’ll be on your way to learning with tracks like Queen’s “We Will Rock You,” Aretha Franklin’s “Chain of Fools,” and Billie Eilish’s “Bad Guy.” To help you grow your skills, Simply Guitar uses live feedback: It will recognize what you’re playing and provide real-time tips on your strum patterns and D chords. Start with basics, follow the lessons, and work your way up to power chords—you'll be playing lead guitar in no time.
editorialNotes.short: Strum away with step-by-step tutorials and get feedback right away.

editorialNotes.tagline: Learn to draw your own way

editorialNotes.short: Engage kids with the essential early curriculum in a fun way.
Expand your programming skills and learn coding on the go.
An immersive AR experience that makes learning fun and effective.

editorialNotes.standard: After experiencing this delightful addition to the series, we’re considering switching careers. From scissors to shavers to insta-grow tonic, we’re astounded by all the tools we can use on our adorably animated clients. After we’ve coiffed, dyed, and dressed them, we love showing off pics of their dramatic ’dos. Sometimes we even let the kids play! Sometimes.
editorialNotes.short: Become a style superstar by experimenting with different looks.

editorialNotes.standard: Whether you’re a bona fide beginner or a seasoned master, Yousician can help you become a better musician. This invaluable resource guides you through thousands of songs packed with guitar and piano techniques like bends, slides, staccatos, and more. A sleek package, real-time feedback, and rewards-based courses make Yousician invaluable.
editorialNotes.short: Learn guitar and piano with real-time feedback and rewards-based courses.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Keep meaning to read more, but just can’t find the time? This is where you’ll find thousands of summaries with key insights you can read or listen to in digestible 15-minute Blinks.
editorialNotes.short: Relatable bite-sized reads to help spark new ideas.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.short: ‣ Develop new skills and advance your career with thousands of online courses

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: With Memrise, language learning’s a game—the irresistible kind that anyone can pick up and play. It teaches you everyday words and phrases—perfect for your next trip abroad—and reinforces them with fun quizzes and playful images. We get an awesome sense of progress every time we use it.
editorialNotes.short: Pick up a new language! Learn how to pronounce phrases from native speakers.
With 24 languages to choose from, Rosetta Stone helps you learn naturally

editorialNotes.standard: Khan Academy Kids teaches early literacy, language, math, and social and emotional skills throughout its more than 1,000 games, videos, and stories. The app integrates science lessons from National Geographic Young Explorer magazine, music from Super Simple Songs, and content from children’s nonfiction publisher Bellwether Media.
editorialNotes.short: Fun activities and lessons to instil skills in maths, phonics and more.
